skillTree.localised_description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: I wear and wield only what I have hunted and gutted myself.
Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Through the skin to kill the soul.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
OBEY!
Only a fool would spring the trap before his prey is ensnared.
After them you dogs!
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
As the Gods demand.
The bracing, frigid chaos winds strengthen the warhost.
Blood calls for blood.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +20% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)
Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Deformed from birth or made so by the Ruinous Powers, yet there is honour within the prison of flesh.
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: I feel daemonic power within me!
Give own power to others... Not very wise.
Spawns gather around him and hear his commands.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Fimir Warrior units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaos Trolls are highly honoured in the eyes of the Changer of the Ways, for rarely does any creature combine mutation with such size, power, and sheer vitality.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Norscan Trolls & Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Physically powerful, armed and armoured with both steel and sorcery, filled with evil intent. Are they even Human?

effects.description:
Upkeep: -4% for Marauder units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaos Giants are instinctively drawn to those who bear the favour of the Dark Gods.

Melee defence: +4 for Norscan Giant units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The blood of our enemies lies here...
Chosen wont serve this little worm, step aside!
The Chaos Gods look on us and smile, there is only war!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Forsaken by the Gods, now, they fight only out of a dark, unnatural hunger and madness.
